titleStmt.title: A musick-lector, or, The art of musick (that is so much vindicated in Christendome) discoursed of by way of dialogue between three men of several judgments the one a musician and master of that art, and zealous for the Church of England ..., the other a Baptist ..., the other a Quaker (so called) ... / written by Solomon Eccles.
titleStmt.author: Eccles, Solomon, 1618-1683.

titleStmt.title: A musick-lector, or, The art of musick (that is so much vindicated in Christendome) discoursed of by way of dialogue between three men of several judgments the one a musician and master of that art, and zealous for the Church of England ..., the other a Baptist ..., the other a Quaker (so called) ... / written by Solomon Eccles.
titleStmt.author: Eccles, Solomon, 1618-1683.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.
